intro: Hymenatherum kunthii, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Hymenatherum kunthii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to soil stabilization and providing food for wildlife.
